title: The Addition Rule
text: We note that P(A AND B) $$=$$ $$0$$. By definition, this means that A and B are mutually exclusive. For two mutually exclusive events, we note that P(A OR $$B)=P\left(A\right)+P\left(B\right)$$. We want to find the probability that Kluas doesn't choose A or B. Therefore, we want to find 1-P(A OR $$B)=1-P\left(A\right)+P\left(B\right)$$.

title: The Addition Rule Applied
text: What is the probability that Klaus chooses neither New Zealand nor Alaska?
speech: What is the probability that Klaus chooses neither New Zealand nor Alaska?
